Event.name: L1 I-Cache miss
Event.Description: L1 Instruction cache miss requires fetch from external memory

Event.name: L1 I-Cache can't deliver
Event.Description: L1 Instruction cache cannot deliver an instruction. This could indicate an instruction cache or TLB miss. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: B and BL instruction retired
Event.Description: Branch instruction retired, branch may or may not have changed program flow. (Counts only B and BL instructions, in both ARM and Thumb mode)

Event.name: Branch mispredicted
Event.Description: Branch mispredicted. (Counts only B and BL instructions, in both ARM and Thumb mode)

Event.name: Instruction executed
Event.Description: Instruction retired. This event steps in a count of the number of executed instructions

Event.name: L1 D-Cache buffer full stall (cycle)
Event.Description: L1 Data cache buffer full stall. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: L1 D-Cache buffer full stall (sequence)
Event.Description: L1 Data cache buffer full stall. This event occurs once for each contiguous sequence of this type of stall

Event.name: L1 D-Cache access
Event.Description: L1 Data cache access, not including Cache Operations. All data accesses are treated as cacheable accesses and are counted here even if the cache is not enabled

Event.name: L1 D-Cache miss
Event.Description: L1 Data cache miss, not including Cache Operations. All data accesses are treated as cacheable accesses and are counted as misses if the data cache is not enabled

Event.name: L1 D-Cache write back
Event.Description: L1 Data cache write-back. This event occurs once for each line (32 bytes) that is written back from the cache

Event.name: Software change of PC
Event.Description: Software changed the PC ('b', 'bx', 'bl', 'blx', 'and', 'eor', 'sub', 'rsb', 'add', 'adc', 'sbc', 'rsc', 'orr', 'mov', 'bic', 'mvn', 'ldm Rn, {..., pc}', 'ldr pc, [...]', pop {..., pc} will be counted). The count does not increment when an exception occurs and the PC changes to the exception address (e.g., IRQ, FIQ, SWI, ...)

Event.name: Branch retired
Event.Description: Branch instruction retired. Branch may or may not have changed program flow. (Count ALL branch instructions, indirect as well as direct)

Event.name: Hold issue stage
Event.Description: Instruction issue cycle of retired instruction. This event is a count of the number of core cycles each instruction requires to issue

Event.name: Pipeline flush
Event.Description: Pipeline flush due to branch mispredict or exception

Event.name: Instruction issue failed
Event.Description: The core could not issue an instruction due to a backend stall. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: Multiplier in use
Event.Description: Multiplier in use. This event will occur every cycle in which the multiplier is active

Event.name: Multiplier stalled pipeline
Event.Description: Multiplier stalled the instruction pipeline due to a resource stall. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: Coprocessor stalled pipeline
Event.Description: Coprocessor stalled the instruction pipeline. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: D-Cache stalled pipeline
Event.Description: Data Cache stalled the instruction pipeline. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: Snoop request stalled pipeline
Event.Description: Snoop request stalled the instruction pipeline. This event will occur every cycle in which the condition is present

Event.name: L2-Cache request
Event.Description: Unified L2 cache request, not including cache operations. This event includes table walks, data and instruction requests

Event.name: L2-Cache snoop or snoop confirm access
Bus grant delay of self initiated address bus transaction
Event.Description: Bus grant delay of self initiated address bus transaction. This event will occur every bus cycle in which the condition is present. (Bus cycle count from request to grant)

Event.name: Bus grant delay of self initiated data bus transaction
Event.Description: Bus grant delay of self initiated data bus transaction. This event will occur every bus cycle in which the condition is present. (Bus cycle count from request to grant)

Event.name: L2-Cache snoop hit on clean cache line
L2-Cache snoop hit on dirty cache line
